statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Samford 55, Tennessee-Martin 41
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) -- Joe Ross Merritt scored a game-high 17 points on 6-of-10 shooting to lead Samford to a 55-41 victory over Tennessee-Martin Thursday night. Samford (8-6, 5-0 Ohio Valley Conference) turned in its best defensive performance so far this season, limiting Tennessee-Martin (3-13, 1-5) to its lowest scoring game this season. "We won the game, but we definitely won it ugly," Samford head coach Jimmy Tillette said. "I have to give a lot of credit to Tennessee-Martin. We played well defensively, especially against them, because they have a very physical basketball team." The Bulldogs held Tennessee-Martin to a 35.7 shooting performance from the field. Samford finished with 47.7 percent from the floor. Travis Peterson and Randall Gulina both scored 13 points for Samford. Peterson finished with a team-high five rebounds, while senior Jerry Smith added four assists. The Bulldogs led 26-18 at halftime. Tennessee-Martin's Zerek Knight scored to start the second half and cut the Bulldogs' lead to 26-20. Samford then went on a 17-9 run and took a commanding 43-29 lead with 8:32 left in the game. Cleve Woodfork led the Skyhawks with 13 points and Gerald Robinson added nine.
